abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings of the First Phase of the Syr
            Darya Control and Northern Aral Sea Project for Kazakhstan
            were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; the risk to
            development outcome was moderate; the Bank's
            performance was moderately satisfactory; and the
            Borrower's performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: while dam
            safety was not an objective of project, in water management
            developments where dam and reservoir safety is identified as
            an item in need of attention, due prioritization should be
            given to execution and completion of the needed amelioration
            measures. For development effectiveness reasons, both
            technical and economic/financial, there is a strong need for
            international river basin water management developments to
            be formulated and implemented in a joint and integrated
            manner within and between all of the riparian countries.
            Specific attention is needed to improve the
            management/administration of the procurement contracts. Use
            of such instruments is envisaged to avoid the delays and
            cost overruns and tackle the procedural/contractual problems
            encountered during project.
